text: ever wondered why retiring can be so
tough for Business Leaders in my recent
hbr piece I share results from my team's
decade long study of retiring Among Us
business professionals we discovered
three big psychological hurdles and how
to clear them first identity issues
ending a career can make professionals
question who they are without their job
what helps identity bridging like
keeping your leader identity Alive by
Leading a community organization
second the fear of leaving meaningful
work many feel like they're leaping into
the void without a clear Next Step those
who transition smoothly often have a
vision for their post-career life third
losing strong workplace relationships a
senior manager described retirement as
going from the center of attention to
Invisible to cope focus on building new
connections and retaining important ones
we found the 4A can help alignment
awareness agency and adaptability assess
alignment between your life and who you
are now be aware of your strengths and
weaknesses exercise agency by making
Necessary changes and adapt to
uncontrollable events there's no right
age to retire it's about knowing
yourself and your job's demands for more
go to hbr.org
